html:
(Mosiah 14:1)."Who hath believed our report?" It is of interest to note how the apostle John later used these words of Isaiah to illustrate the lack of belief on the part of the people in his days: "But though he [Jesus] had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not on him:

"That the saying of Esaias [the Greek form of Isaiah] the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spake, Lord, who hath believed our report? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?" (John 12:37-38.)
